81b06c92-328e-4f2c-ad13-3d359e187216.description: Earners of this badge have the foundational knowledge required to work day-to-day in clinical safety and pharmacovigilance. They understand the legal basis for safety reporting, including a historical perspective; basic definitions and tools; and the mechanics of drug safety and pharmacovigilance. They can also reference safety information provided by the Investigator’s Brochure and post-marketing labeling as well as evaluate the seriousness, expectedness, and causality of adverse events.
81b06c92-328e-4f2c-ad13-3d359e187216.name: Introduction to Drug Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

bcf1d7be-2a7e-477d-bf91-0eb562c22eaa.description: Earners of this badge have the foundational knowledge required to understand the basic concepts of safety signal detection. They can explain the use of statistics in safety data mining, and their role in signal detection. They can discuss the basic principles of pharmacoepidemiology in the context of interpreting signaling results.
bcf1d7be-2a7e-477d-bf91-0eb562c22eaa.name: Basics of Signal Detection and Pharmacoepidemiology

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

58db3e23-fb78-42ca-af83-23ddf76f3586.description: Earners of the Drug Safety Regulatory Requirements badge can identify key harmonization initiatives in drug safety. They understand important regulations in both the US and the EU.
58db3e23-fb78-42ca-af83-23ddf76f3586.name: Drug Safety Regulatory Requirements

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% in post-assessment.

d5add59f-74a1-428f-a0f0-53bf887faf37.description: Earners of this badge can discuss the requirements for aggregate reporting of adverse events in marketed products. They can also describe the efforts that have been made internationally to standardize benefit-risk assessment in post-marketing phase. They are able to compare risk management plan requirements in the EU with risk evaluation and mitigation strategies (REMS) that are required in the US during post-marketing.
d5add59f-74a1-428f-a0f0-53bf887faf37.name: Post-marketing Safety Management

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

b0c9854b-fe0d-4ccf-9a2e-a8ee29a8e215.description: Earners of the Pre-marketing Clinical Trial Safety badge demonstrate knowledge in drug safety requirements for clinical trails for humans and can discuss risk assessment in clinical trials. They can explain pre-marketing individual case reporting and aggregate reporting requirements and discuss the pre-marketing review of safety data in a marketing application.
b0c9854b-fe0d-4ccf-9a2e-a8ee29a8e215.name: Pre-Marketing Clinical Trial Safety

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

c24af160-938b-4484-bb38-f5c65b6aacb2.description: Earners of this badge have successfully demonstrated knowledge in defining the scope and types of audits and inspections. They can describe FDA, EMA, MHRA, and Health Canada inspections and possible sanctions. They can explain how a company should respond to an FDA inspection, including the Corrective and Preventive Action (or CAPA) Plan and best practices for the company's management of audits and inspections.
c24af160-938b-4484-bb38-f5c65b6aacb2.name: Safety Audits and Inspections

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 3.75 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

4ff354c6-ab2d-4b59-9c61-0d7ebaef993a.description: This badge holder has the ability to define and describe the purpose of prescription drug and biologics product labeling. They can define and identify the components of the Company Core Data Sheet (CCDS). The can identify the components and explain the structure and use of the Prescribing Information and the Medication Guide in the US and the Prescribing Information and Patient Labeling in the European Union.
4ff354c6-ab2d-4b59-9c61-0d7ebaef993a.name: Product Labeling

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 3 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

be7fdd59-4378-45a5-9d33-164d060dbe1a.description: Learners will understand the principles of safety sciences including toxicology, clinical pharmacology, pharmacogenomics, and pharmacoepidemiology to enable them to analyze potential safety issues, and to better understand the patient population and its experience with the drug.
be7fdd59-4378-45a5-9d33-164d060dbe1a.name: Basic Safety Sciences: Pharmacoepidemiology, Clinical Pharmacology, Pharmacogenomics, and Toxicology Studies

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

f36b73bc-2aa6-4c5a-a3fe-0482464413cf.description: This badge holder can explain essential aspects of medical writing of aggregate safety reports (PSURs and PBRERs) in the context of current legal framework in the EU and globally. They can describe the requirements set out in the ICH E2C(R2) guideline on the PBRER, EU Good Pharmacovigilance Practices (GVP) - Module VII, as well as global acceptability and local variability in the requirements. They can describe the critical aspects of medical writing, including data editing and presentation.
f36b73bc-2aa6-4c5a-a3fe-0482464413cf.name: Medical Writing of Periodic Safety Update Reports (PSUR/PBRER)

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course.

dc974921-2c76-42ae-b35b-ff0f676e0d21.description: Earners of this badge have completed a 3-day training course where they learned contemporary principles, regulatory expectations, and practical approaches to drug safety and pharmacovigilance in key regulatory jurisdictions, with a focus on the US and EU.
dc974921-2c76-42ae-b35b-ff0f676e0d21.name: Drug Safety Across the Product Lifecycle

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 3-day course and completed a post-assessment.

7335f136-8a99-49a1-94db-87e91bd0be06.description: This badge holder can describe the types of contract service providers. They can explain best practices for the selection and management of pharmacovigilance service providers, including governance. They can discuss inspections of outsourced safety service providers, including regulatory authority expectations for pharmacovigilance agreements between sponsors/marketing authorization holders and contract service providers.
7335f136-8a99-49a1-94db-87e91bd0be06.name: Selecting and Managing Outsourced Safety Providers

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 1.25 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

af3e38e7-940f-47a4-b1d5-e20da229534c.description: This badge holder can describe how to design, develop, and manage a quality system related to a pharmacovigilance system. They can explain the development, maintenance, and quality oversight of pharmacovigilance SOPs and pharmacovigilance related documents, including Safety Management Plans and Pharmacovigilance Agreements across clinical study programs and post-marketing.
af3e38e7-940f-47a4-b1d5-e20da229534c.name: The Pharmacovigilance Quality Management System

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

2c3e2bbf-5b81-4f9f-9369-0ad269394c17.description: Earners of this badge have the foundational knowledge required to integrate the patient perspective into the full medicines lifecycle, including regulatory decision making and post-marketing efforts, which can improve patient outcomes and increase the success of the product.
2c3e2bbf-5b81-4f9f-9369-0ad269394c17.name: Introduction to Patient Engagement in Drug Development

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 1 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

87396f11-0837-4d34-8d58-eb4350b8d914.description: This badge holder can discuss the principles and regulatory basis for benefit-risk obligations and frameworks for compliance. They can conduct a benefit-risk assessment, develop and maintain a benefit-risk assessment plan, and select appropriate risk minimization tools. They can describe the importance of the patient in assessing benefit-risk balance.
87396f11-0837-4d34-8d58-eb4350b8d914.name: Benefit-Risk Assessment and Management

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

04d892b1-e9dd-4f43-9b7b-f1d071d2d808.description: Badge earners have earned 2 credits to complete the Elective Track as part of the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program.
04d892b1-e9dd-4f43-9b7b-f1d071d2d808.name: Elective Track

badge_template_activities.title: Earned 2 credits, completing Elective Track requirements.

a8d4984b-46db-4365-8fef-8bab4a109366.description: This badge holder can explain the obligations of the marketing authorization holder and QPPV responsibilities. They can describe how to prepare for audits and inspections and how to oversee the PV system.
a8d4984b-46db-4365-8fef-8bab4a109366.name: Advanced Workshop on QPPV Toolbox

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course.

916137d8-4220-4e4b-9fc3-61817a09b7bc.description: Earners of this badge can identify approaches to determine current practices and attitudes about patient focus within the organization as well as various strategies and resources to help shift culture to enable necessary change and action to becoming a more patient-focused organization. They can also identify critical stakeholders within and outside of the organization to affect culture change.
916137d8-4220-4e4b-9fc3-61817a09b7bc.name: Creating a Patient-Focused Culture eLearning Module

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 4 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

d944f7ec-1bb9-4b4f-a4dd-9d473ca6d351.description: Earners of the Preparing for Purposeful Patient Organization Partnerships badge can showcase an understanding of patient advocacy communities, changing capacities and expectations, and emerging best practices in fostering partnerships between life science organizations and patient organizations.
d944f7ec-1bb9-4b4f-a4dd-9d473ca6d351.name: Preparing for Purposeful Patient Organization Partnerships eLearning Module

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 3 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

c93dcdc2-2dac-42e3-a5d0-6c82cc8df587.description: Earners of the Legal and Compliance Considerations for Engaging Patients As Partners badge demonstrate knowledge of how to successfully incorporate ethical, legal, and regulatory requirements into your patient engagement activities.
c93dcdc2-2dac-42e3-a5d0-6c82cc8df587.name: Legal and Compliance Considerations for Engaging Patients As Partners eLearning Module

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 2 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

4118865a-1e0a-486c-9d8f-c2731b24f3ac.description: This badge holder has the knowledge to discuss the key concepts, principles, and tools used in risk management and risk minimization. They can compare and contrast the EU RMP with the US REMS, and identify core elements common in both.
4118865a-1e0a-486c-9d8f-c2731b24f3ac.name: Safety Risk Management A Focus on US REMS and EU RMPs

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

cffdcb66-12a9-4b5b-839d-ee32b91392c9.description: Earners of the Patient Engagement Evaluation and Metrics badge will be able to state the importance of evaluation and patient focused/patient engagement efforts. The can also discuss the process for developing patient engagement metrics, including setting objectives, defining expected outcomes, and identifying relevant measures.
cffdcb66-12a9-4b5b-839d-ee32b91392c9.name: Patient Engagement Evaluation and Metrics

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 3.5 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

8c2761ef-6575-4f5f-8bf3-f0158f061bc9.description: Earners of the Developing a Comprehensive Patient Engagement Program badge will be able to utilize the the tools to build a strategic, systematic, and sustainable patient engagement program within their organization that both meets the expectations of patient communities and accounts for market factors that demand patient input.
8c2761ef-6575-4f5f-8bf3-f0158f061bc9.name: Developing a Comprehensive Patient Engagement Program

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 3 hour course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessment.

23db42ee-999b-41c6-9094-9d1826144ef0.description: This badge holder can explain the science of risk communication for medicinal products, the relevant regulatory context in the US and EU, the basics of risk communication in product risk management, and new directions in the field, including the use of digital and other eHealth methods and patient-centered approaches to risk communication. The can evaluate risk communication strategies for feasibility, effectiveness, and patient-centeredness.
23db42ee-999b-41c6-9094-9d1826144ef0.name: Safety Risk Communication for Medical Products

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

9b23d590-e64a-4300-8e49-ec4144fa6100.description: This badge holder can describe the basic principles, best industry practices, and regulatory expectations for report writing in pharmacovigilance. They will have a clear understanding of the purpose of each section of safety reports, and how to analyze the safety data, draw conclusions, and use proper medical writing techniques to succinctly document safety data and avoid duplication.
9b23d590-e64a-4300-8e49-ec4144fa6100.name: Essentials of Safety Medical Writing

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

b8557ac2-6b3f-45f8-aec3-bcce1041006f.description: Individuals holding this certificate have demonstrated achievement of the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Competency Framework. This certificate program requires completion of the learning path which includes 17 core and two elective credits, as well as the successful completion of the certificate program exam with a score of 75% or better. The badge is issued for a lifetime.
b8557ac2-6b3f-45f8-aec3-bcce1041006f.name: Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Earned 17 Core Track credits, 2 Elective Track credits, and passed the exam with a score of 80% or better to complete the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program Learning Path.
Passed the exam with a score of 80% or better.
Completed 17 Core Track credits and 2 Elective Track credits as part of the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program.

114bac66-c22b-4001-9220-809633f1d60e.description: Badge earners have passed the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program exam.
114bac66-c22b-4001-9220-809633f1d60e.name: Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program Exam

badge_template_activities.title: Passed the exam with a score of 80% or better

a5522f93-dc57-43d5-899b-4218cb26dd11.description: Badge earners have completed a 2 hour eLearning module on training development and adult learning principles, benefits of training, key training stakeholders, learning styles, training needs assessments and evaluations. Tips for creating effective presentations and a positive learning environment as well as methods for dealing with difficult participants are provided. Keys to apply learning strategies to various learning objectives are introduced.
a5522f93-dc57-43d5-899b-4218cb26dd11.name: Train the Trainer eLearning Module

badge_template_activities.title: Completed the 2 hour eLearning module.

f585d989-2c69-4e94-949e-da9abbc94d2f.description: Earners of this badge have completed the 6 Patient Engagement modules, covering key elements of patient engagement. They were provided the fundamentals about why and how to incorporate patient focus and build organization-wide capabilities.
f585d989-2c69-4e94-949e-da9abbc94d2f.name: Patient Engagement eLearning Program

badge_template_activities.title: Successfully complete the 15.75 hours course and achieve a passing score of 80% on post-assessments.

285f5210-5f9d-496a-8995-3bb3fc426039.description: Earners of this badge can describe how to use medical knowledge in the diagnosis and management of selected Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs). They can explain how to classify and define drug-induced affective symptoms, skin reactions, QT interval prolongation, blood disorders, drug-induced liver injury (DILI), and acute renal failure. They can outline how to approach causality assessment in DILI.
285f5210-5f9d-496a-8995-3bb3fc426039.name: Medical Approach in Diagnosis and Management of ADRs

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course.

e10c563a-953f-4f9e-8d4e-cb1d50ac1a01.description: This badge holder will have advanced knowledge to create an efficient, compliant, multidisciplinary process for signal detection and management. They have the ability to interpret outputs from automated quantitative signal detection methods and apply structured medical assessment to safety signal evaluation. They can design governance processes for signal escalation, decision-making, action, and communication.
e10c563a-953f-4f9e-8d4e-cb1d50ac1a01.name: Advanced Signal Management – Detection, Evaluation, and Decision-Making

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 2-day course and completed a post-assessment.

36a16ea5-ae5b-483a-a674-cb4e9f4f47fe.description: This badge holder can describe the basic guidelines, best industry practices, and regulatory expectations for report writing in pharmacovigilance. They will have a clear understanding of the purpose of each section of safety reports, and how to interpret the safety data, draw conclusions, and use proper medical writing techniques to succinctly document safety data and avoid duplication.
36a16ea5-ae5b-483a-a674-cb4e9f4f47fe.name: Safety Report Writing: Best Practices for Writing Clear, Effective Safety Reports

badge_template_activities.title: Complete 1 day course.

7c9e59bb-118f-4664-85a1-28922577fc5d.description: Badge earners have earned 17 credits to complete the Core Track as part of the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program.
7c9e59bb-118f-4664-85a1-28922577fc5d.name: Core Track

badge_template_activities.title: Earned 17 credits, completing the Core Track requirements.

7b5a2b79-c04e-4971-9c1f-d752100e3d61.description: Earner of this badge have completed a 1-day training course and can describe the regulations and guidance documents driving the practice of signal detection in the US and EU. They can define signal detection and differentiate the stages of a signal management system, and discuss various methods of qualitative and quantitative signal detection and data mining.
7b5a2b79-c04e-4971-9c1f-d752100e3d61.name: Introduction to Signal Detection and Data Mining

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 1-day course and completed a post-assessment.

c265d35e-61aa-40eb-8599-2dd4166f42cc.description: This badge holder has completed a 1-day training course and has the basic knowledge of how to prepare for an audit/inspection. They can outline different types of inspections and audits from around the world, including EMA, UK MHRA, and US FDA.
c265d35e-61aa-40eb-8599-2dd4166f42cc.name: How to Prepare for a Safety Inspection

badge_template_activities.title: Attended a 1-day course and completed a post-assessment.

072f2cc0-1904-4be4-9555-f64448f57dec.description: Individuals holding this certificate have demonstrated achievement of the DIA Patient Engagement Competency Framework. This certificate program requires completion of the learning path which includes 6 program credits, as well as the successful completion of the certificate program exam with a score of 75% or better. The badge is issued for a lifetime.
072f2cc0-1904-4be4-9555-f64448f57dec.name: Patient Engagement Certificate Program

badge_template_activities.title: Patient engagement is an important strategy in the medical product development lifecycle and is defined as direct and constructive interaction with patients in the full medicines life cycle to enable practices that are based on patient perspectives and that result in outcomes that meet patient needs as well as the developer’s needs.

3da8cf7c-1938-4cc7-8db5-88aa6538716f.description: Badge earners have passed the DIA Safety and Pharmacovigilance Certificate Program exam.
3da8cf7c-1938-4cc7-8db5-88aa6538716f.name: Patient Engagement Certificate Program Exam

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have achieved a passing score of 75% or higher.

0b41203b-86f8-4bb7-a71b-500ac6d7b2b7.description: Badge earners have earned 6 credits to complete the Program Track as part of the DIA Patient Engagement Certificate Program, covering key elements of patient engagement. They were provided the fundamentals about why and how to incorporate patient focus and build organization-wide capabilities.
0b41203b-86f8-4bb7-a71b-500ac6d7b2b7.name: Patient Engagement Program Track

badge_template_activities.title: Earned 6 credits by completing the Patient Engagement Program courses.
